FXUS04 KWBC 281004 PAA
QPFPFD
 
QUANTITATIVE PRECIPITATION FORECAST DISCUSSION
NWS HYDROMETEOROLOGICAL PREDICTION CENTER CAMP SPRINGS MD
503 AM EST TUE JAN 28 2003
 
FINAL DAY 1...DAY 2 AND DAY 3 QPF DISCUSSION
VALID JAN 29/1200 UTC THRU JAN 31/1200 UTC
REFERENCE AWIPS GRAPHICS UNDER...PRECIP ACCUM - 24HR
 


DAY 1...


THERE WAS LITTLE DIFFERENCE BTWN THE 0000 UTC AND 0600 UTC MODEL
RUNS.  THE ETA AND GFS MASS FIELD FCSTS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT
ACROSS THE NATION THRU DAY1 WITH ANY DIFFERENCES BEING IN THE
NOISE LEVEL.   MINOR CHANGES..MOSTLY DUE TO CURRENT
OBSERVATIONAL DATA...WERE MADE FM THE PRELIM TO THE FINAL DAY1.

......MIDWEST ACROSS THE NRN PORTION OF THE OH VLY...

MOISTURE AVBLTY WILL BE ON THE INCREASE HERE AS A STG LLVL SLY
WIND COMPONENT ADVECTS HIER MSTR INTO AN E/W ORIENTED
BAROCLINIC ZONE.   A VERY WEAK WAA IS EXPECTED OVR THE OH VLY
EARLY IN THE PD.   THE BULK OF THE PCPN DEPICTED HOWEVER WILL BE
TRIGGERED BY THE DYNAMIC LIFT ASOCTD WITH THE SHRTWV FCST TO BE
PRESSING EWD ACROSS THE CNTRL U.S. BY THIS EVNG.  IN GNRL LGT
PCPN AMTS ARE EXPECTED WITH THIS SYSTEM.   THE 0000 UTC GFS WAS
HEAVIER THAN THE ETA WITH AMTS OVER THE MIDWEST THRU THE FIRST
HALF OF THE PD AND BELIEVED IT WAS OVERDONE GIVEN THE FCSTS OF
AVBL PW AND RECENT WET BIAS ON ITS PART.   MORE TROUBLING WAS
THAT THE 0000 UTC GFS PCPN AXIS IN GNRL WAS SLIGHTLY NORTH OF THE
ETAS AND THE ETA HAD TRENDED A BIT NWD FM ITS PREVIOUS RUN.  
FORTUNATELY...THE 0600 MODEL RUNS WHETHER RIGHT OR WRONG
BASICALLY CONVERGED ON BOTH AMTS AND THE AXIS OF PCPN.   A
COMPROMISE BTWN THE MINOR REMAINING DIFFERENCES IS PROBABLY
THE BEST BET.

...LWR MS/TN/AND SRN OH VLY...

DIFFICULTY HERE IS TRYING TO GAUGE WHEN AND WHERE ENUF MSTR
WILL BE AVBL TO SATURATE THE ENVIRONMENT AHEAD OF THE
AFOREMENTIONED SHRTWV ADVANCING EWD FM THE CNTRL U.S. BY THIS
EVNG.   BOTH THE ETA AND GFS HAVE SOME DIFFERENCES HERE BUT
BOTH BASICALLY AGREE THAT SHWRS WILL DVLP ACROSS THIS REGION AS
HGT FALLS GRADUALLY SQUEEZE MSTR OUT OF THE ATMOSPHERE.  
ATTEMPTED A COMPROMISE BTWN THE TWO QPF SOLUTIONS GIVEN THE
LACK OF SGFNT MODEL DIFFERENCES.

...NRN PLAINS...

OVRRNG OF ANOTHER ARCTIC FRONT DROPPING SWD ACROSS THIS
REGION WILL TRIGGER VERY LGT PCPN TOTALS.   THE ETA AND GFS ARE IN
GOOD AGREEMENT ON DETAILS HERE.




DAY 2...

SE...

SLOW MOVING COLD FRONT DRAPED ACRS THE REGION WILL ACT AS A
FOCUS FOR MSTR FEEDING UP FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO AS SRN
STREAM S/WV ENERGY SHEARS EWD ACRS THE REGION.  OVERALL.. THE
ETA AND GFS ARE IN RELATIVELY GOOD AGREEMENT HERE WITH THE
PCPN AND BASICALLY JUST WENT WITH COMPROMISE SOLN.

PAC NW...

GOOD AGREEMENT HERE ALSO BETWEEN THE ETA AND THE GFS AS THEY
BRING A FAIRLY POTENT S/WV OUT OF THE ERN PACIFIC INTO THE NW. 
SUPPORTED BY GOOD ONSHORE FLOW INTO THE REGION... THIS SYSTEM
WILL PRODUCE MDT TO HVY RNFL ALONG THE COASTAL RANGES OF WA
AND OR AND INTO NRN CA.  THE ETA IS WETTER HERE THAN THE GFS AND
GIVEN THE RATHER IMPRESSIVE 20 TO 30 KT LOW LEVEL JET FEEDING INTO
THE FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS WITH PW'S OVER AN INCH... CAN SEE NO
REASON TO NOT GO WITH THE HEAVIER SOLN.


DAY3....

LITTLE IN THE WAY OF SGFNT CHANGE FROM DAY2 INTO DAY3 AS
PERSISTENT ONSHORE FLOW INTO THE PACIFIC NW CONTINUES TO BRING
PLENTY OF MSTR INTO THE REGION. ETA AND GFS ARE ACTUALLY IN
BETTER AGREEMENT ON DAY3 THAN THEY WERE ON DAY2 WITH BOTH
SHOWING BETWEEN 40 AND 50 KTS OF LOW LEVEL JET BRINGING PW'S IN
EXCESS OF AN INCH INTO THE COASTAL RANGES OF WA AND OR AND ALSO
FARTHER INLAND INTO THE CASCADES. SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVING
EWD WILL ALSO BRING LT TO MDT RAINS.. WITH SNOW AT THE HIER
ELEVS..
THRU THE NRN INTRMTN REGION AND INTO THE NRN ROCKIES.  FARTHER
EAST... MSTR WILL STILL CONTINUE TO FOCUS INTO THE WEAKENING
BNDRY DRAPED ACROSS THE SE.




KORTY/ROBSON

GRAPHICS AVAILABLE ON THE WEB AT http://www.hpc.ncep.noaa.gov
